destinations.name: Amboseli
destinations.info: Amboseli National Park is one of the best wildlife-viewing destinations in the world, with the view of mt. Longonot and hosts different types of animals including the Big five.

destinations.name: Mombasa
destinations.info: Mombasa is the largest city on the Kenyan coast and combines city excitement with beach relaxation. The coastal area features nearly 500 kilometres of tranquil white beaches, golden sand dunes, warm aqua water and idyllic secluded islands.

destinations.name: Queen Elizabeth National Park
destinations.info: QENP is in the Western Region of Uganda.The park is known for its abundant wildlife, including African elephant, African buffalo, Ugandan kob, hippopotamus, topi, waterbuck, warthog, giant forest hog, Nile crocodile, leopard, spotted hyena, chimpanzee and lion.

destinations.name: Zanzibar
destinations.info: Zanzibar Island is known as Africa's tropical paradise, offering the world's most beautiful beaches. Here, you find miles and miles of white sandy beaches dotted with palm trees, surrounded by the clear azure water of the Indian Ocean.

destinations.name: Cape Town
destinations.info: Famous for its sun, sea and scenery, Cape Town is a beloved tourist destination for visitors the world over. It's, therefore, no surprise that this coastal gem has been voted the best city in the world seven-years-running!

destinations.name: Dubai
destinations.info: Dubai is a city of skyscrapers, ports, and beaches, where big business takes place alongside sun-seeking tourism.
